string.text: {=!}You have the look of someone who's never seen a spec of black powder nor grease. Are you in the right place?
{=!}Ah, you have returned. What news do you bring?
{=!}Come back to me when you have news.
{=!}Did you find {ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME}?
{= !}Have you changed your mind and want to help hunt down {ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME}?
{=!}You again, what do you want?
I would like to buy some cannons.
I would like to recruit some engineers.
How can I use cannons?
How can I buy more cannons?
Nothing at the moment, I must leave.
{=!}I have reconsidered your offer, I would like to help.
{=!}Greetings Master Engineer, I am {PlAYERNAME}. I have come seeking access to the Forges of Nuln. Can you help?
{=!}I am, I have come seeking access to black powder weapons.
{=!}Hah!, you don’t look like you would even know what to do with them. What could you possibly need with our crafts?
{=!}I am far too busy for this, leave my sight.

{=!}These are the mightiest weapons of the Empire, they hold back the tide of darkness time and again. We do not hand out our crafts to any who waltz in, I do not know you. Nor have you earned our trust.

{=!}We may however be able to come to an agreement, there is an internal matter that needs urgent attention and I am unable to act. If you help, as a personal favour, I will see what I can do for you. What say you?
{=!}What would you have me do?
{=!}I don't have time for this.

{=!}Usually we don’t resort to outside assistance but we are short handed, we have had some important components stolen from the Forges of Nuln and they must be returned. Immediately. If you can track down these runaways and find these parts then we can talk further.
{=!}I can, as long as our bargain remains the same. I will find him for you, and in return, you will allow me access to the Forges of Nuln.
{=!}If this is the only way you will allow me access to the forges, then so be it. I will bring you his head.
{=!}I’m afraid not, I have other tasks to attend to.
{=!}We have an agreement then, I believe I may know his whereabouts. I will mark it on your map for you, may Sigmar guide you stranger.
{=!}I understand, I will return the moment I have news.
{=!}That is all it will take? Sounds easy enough.
{=!}I do not have time for this.
Good, I expect positive results and your hasty return.
A shame, think on it and return if you change your mind.
{=!}I am afraid I have failed to bring what you ask.
{=!}Tsk, I expected better. There may still be time, you can still track them if you are swift
{=!}I won't let you down a second time.
{=!}I don't think I can do it at this time.
{=!}I have returned but without the stolen components, I am afraid to say they are still missing.
{=!}I see, this is not what I had hoped for. Were there any further clues, did you interrogate these scoundrels?
{=!}One of the bandits did mention a name, {ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME} I think?

{=!}Blast! I should have known. If you are willing, I would ask for your assistance once more. This matter may be more dire than I originally imagined. {ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME} is an Engineer, a good one at that, but his works always seemed...wrong.
{=!}If he has stolen these parts, it can only be for something heinous. I must ask that you track him down, and put an end to whatever madness he is trying to concoct. Will you do this?
I have yet to track down the runaways.
I see, return to me when you have something useful.
{ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME} will no longer be a problem and I have retrieved what he stole from you. I’m unsure what he was trying to do with them.

It matters not, it would have been something warped no doubt. I must thank you for your efforts, and your discretion. As agreed upon, you may now access our foundries and purchase from us as you please.
Now, how can I help?
I have yet to track him down
I see, return to me when you have better news.
Of course, you'll find only the best from the Forges of Nuln!
What else can I do for you?
{=!}A pair of our novice engineers are eagier to join you for the right price ({RECRUITMENT_PRICE}).
Welcome on board.
I don't have the funds for them right now.
On a second thought, maybe later.
To buy cannons you must be in the service of an Imperial Elector Count
The amount of cannons you can field in your army increases every 50 levels in Engineering skill.
If you have met these requirements, simply speak to me and I'll show you what we have.
Cannons are placed using the spellcasting Mode, but to fire the cannons you will need to hire at least two Cannon Crew
You will also need to ensure that the cannon is in your party inventory
Engineers and Cannon Crew can both fire cannons.
{ROGUE_ENGINEER_NAME} was right, they sent someone after us! Grab your weapons quickly!
Woah hold there, I have merely come for the stolen parts, there is no need to shed blood here. Perhaps an arrangement can be made?
Lay down your weapons and I may spare your lives.
Weapons or no, we will slay you all and take back what you stole!
You will not trick us! They will serve a greater purpose! You will not take them!
So the old fool sent you to find me? How did he figure me out? It matters not, you will stand in the way of my creations. You will die here!
Your schemes end here
{=!}Vampire Counts
{=!}Empire of Men

{=!}The Vampire Counts are fiends without equal. They seek to topple the civilisations of the living and supplant them with an Undead empire. Each Vampire is a unique and majestic figure with his own personality, drive and ambition. In contrast, their minions are mindlessly obedient - rank after rank of ragged and dirt-encrusted cadavers forced back to life by their masters' necromantic power.

{=!}The empire is a vast nation of Men that fights for its survival with each passing day. Ruled over by the Emperor, Karl Franz, the discipline and martial skill of its armies is renowned throughout the Old World. The backbone of the Empire’s military might, and the reason it has endured in a world filled with both brutal savages and bloodthirsty monsters, is its armies of professional soldiers.
{=!}a count
{=!}a countess
{=!}elector count
{=!}elector countess
{=!}a lord
{=!}a lady
{=!}Vampire Lord
{=!}Vampire Lady
{=!}the Empire
{=!}I hereby swear to serve the Grand County of Averland.
{=!}I proclaim the Elector Count, Marius Leitdorf as my rightful lord and better looking than Kurt Helboring.
{=!}I uphold my sword to protect the sun-kissed lands of Averland, its people, its cattle and above all: the sweet wines.
{=!}I recognise you as My lord and Saviour, and will follow you to the depths of hell and back and back to hell and... - ahem - back.
{=!}I hereby swear loyalty to the Grand County of Stirland.
{=!}I acknowledge Alberich Haupt-Anderssen, Grand Count of Stirland, Prince of Wurtbad and Overlord of Sylvania as my lord and liege until my dying day.
{=!}May my body be Stirland’s shield in defence of the undead threat.
{=!}I will follow you to the deepest parts of the dead lands.
{=!}I hereby swear my loyalty to Nuln, Bastion of the South and the Jewel of the Empire and the lesser surrounding villages, castles and towns of Wissenland.
{=!}I recognise Emmanuelle von Liebwitz, Grand Countess of Wissenland, Countess of Nuln and Duchess of Meissen as my eternal lady.
{=!}In times of dire need, i will defend Nuln to the best of ability.
{=!}I pledge to follow you wherever you lead and will defend you till my dying day.
{=!}I hereby swear undying loyalty to the Grand Duchy of Talabecland.
{=!}I recognise Helmut Feuerbach, Grand Duke of Talabecland, Margrave of the East March and Beloved of Taal as my eternal lord.
{=!}In times of need, I will defend the Taalbaston until my dying breath.
{=!}I shall aid you in defence of Taal’s holy ground until the end of days.

{=!}I hereby swear eternal servitude to Reikland and its sovereign, Karl Franz Holswig-Schliestein, Protector of the Empire, Defier of the Dark, Sigmar's Heir, Emperor of the South, and Son of Emperors.
{=!}I pledge my soul to the warrior god Sigmar, his foes will know my wrath.
{=!}May your foes recognise me as their eternal enemy, for as long as there is breath within my body I will not rest.
{=!}All hail to Karl Franz, whom I will follow into the depths of the abyss.
{=!}I hereby swear to serve the Grand County of the Mootland.
{=!}I proclaim the elder Hisme Stoutheart as my rightful liege.
{=!}I uphold my sword to protect the people against the undead menace.
{=!}I pledge to aid you in peace and in times of war alike.
{=!}I Pledge mine soul to the eternal servitude of the lands of Sylvania.
{=!}I hereby sweareth mine undying loyalty to Mannfred von Carstein, Count of Sylvania, the most cunning and magically gifted vampire of all of the von Carstein bloodlines.
{=!}May thine enemies tremble at the sight of me and mine undead legions.
{=!}I shall join thine court and follow thee deep into the lands of the empire.

{=!}I proclaim you a noble of the Empire. Your life and property shall be protected by our laws, and shall not be taken from you except by law. You may serve as an official over towns and villages and as a general over armies, if we call upon you to do so.
{=!}I proclaim you a noble of the Sylvania and a servant of the von Carsteins. You are expected to carry out our bidding and bear arms in times of war.
{=!}Elector Count of one of the Provinces of the Empire
{=!}Elector Countess of one of the Provinces of the Empire
{=!}Ruler of the province of Sylvania
{=!}Vampire Lady of Sylvania
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK} of the house of {CLAN_NAME}.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the house of {CLAN_NAME}. Our family has served the Empire for generations.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the house of {CLAN_NAME}. Our family has discharged its duties honorably since the days of Sigmar himself.

{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the house of {CLAN_NAME}. Though one should not be too proud of one's lineage, I am glad to say that we have always taken seriously our duty to protect the common folk of the Empire.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the house of {CLAN_NAME}, one of the most illustrious families in the annals of the Empire.

{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the house of {CLAN_NAME}, one of the most illustrious families in the annals of the Empire. What is best in life? To crush your enemies. See them driven before you. And to hear the lamentations of their women.
{=!}Know that if you ever cross me, you'll wind up as undead fodder in our armies.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK} of the {CLAN_NAME}.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. I am sure you have heard the name of our clan whispered in fear among the soldiers of the Empire.
{=!}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. Our clan has loyally served the von Carsteins for generations.
{=!}Use combat prayers.
{=!}Fight with a firearm.
{=!}Cast spells, do damage with magic.
{=smthma}TOR-Two-Handed Mace
{=!}One Handed Sword
{=!}Two Handed Sword
{=!}One Handed Axe
{=!}Two Handed Axe
{=!}Two Handed Mace
{=!}One Handed Polearm
{=!}Two Handed Polearm
{=!}Couche Lance
{=!}You arrive at an active chaos portal. The vile thing pulses with arcane magic, chaos forces are invading in minor numbers from their realm.
{=!}The portal lies dormant. Come back at a later time.
{=!}Attempt to defeat the chaos forces present and close the portal.
{=!}My story? Sure, I can share it.
{=!}As a boy I discovered I was not like most children, it was not long before the colleges realised this as well.
{=!}Once my affinity for Aqshy was known, I was ripped from my peasant life and become an initiate within the Colleges in Altdorf.
{=!}That fire in Altdorf a few years back that started in a tavern? Definitely wasn't me!.
{=!}Most interesting.
{=!}I am a licensed Bright Wizard from the Colleges in Altdorf. I'm sure by now you have met a few of us and may know how powerful we can be.
{=!}The story of my life is insignificant, but I will speak.
{=!}I was an Orphan left at the doors of the Church, the Cult of Sigmar took me in and raised me.
{=!}I have studied many holy scriptures and dedicated my life to the never-ending battle against the filth of Chaos.
{=!}I roam the countryside and purge heresy with unwavering determination.
{=!}This has my consent.
{=!}Have you finished?
{=!}I'm a warrior priest of Sigmar and no corruption will escape my wrath.
{=!}It is not much of a tale, but I will speak of my life.
{=!}My mother worked in a brothel, we barely had enough to eat. Never knew my father.
{=!}I had to learn to defend myself from drunken clients at a very young age. My mother wouldn't leave no matter how much I begged her.
{=!}One day things went too far, one of her clients was trying to take her life in some kind of strange ritual. I stole his knife and ended it, soon after I left and joined the Templars.
{=!}You are doing Sigmar's work!
{=!}That is downright pitiful.
{=!}I am a Witch Hunter, a Templar of Sigmar. The guilty cannot escape me.
{=!}My story isn't that unique, but I don't mind talking about it.
{=!}I was born the child of a hedge wizard, when I too showed magical affinity I was sent to the Colleges.
{=!}I was always top of my classes. The others accused me of hubris, but they were merely blinded by their mediocrity.
{=!}You cannot find a more promising wizard in the realms of the Empire. I am on the path to surpass Balthazar Gelt himself!
{=!}I see.
{=!}Pff, how ridiculous.
{=!}I am a Light Wizard from the Imperial Colleges. I have no doubts that you have heard of our immense skill.
{=!}My story isn't that unique, but I don't mind talking about it.
{=!}I was born the child of a hedge wizard, when I too showed magical affinity I was sent to the Colleges.
{=!}I was always top of my classes. The others accused me of hubris, but they were merely blinded by their mediocrity.
{=!}You cannot find a more promising wizard in the realms of the Empire. I am on the path to surpass Balthazar Gelt himself!
{=!}I see.
{=!}Pff, how ridiculous.
{=!}I am a Celestial Wizard from the Imperial Colleges. I have no doubts that you have heard of our immense skill.
{=!}I was born into a family of serfs, but working the fields was no life for me!
{=!}I became the apprentice of a master alchemist, but the bastard taught me nothing yet worked me to death for years.
{=!}I left him on the side of the road when his wagon broke down one day and joined the army where I learned to maintain equipment. Explosives are my newly found passion.
{=!}Most interesting.
{=!}Have you finished?
{=!}I am an Engineer experienced in the operation and maintenance of gunpowder weapons.
{=!}I have no qualms speaking of my life stranger.
{=!}I was born into a noble family from Carcassonne, my father was a Knight before me.
{=!}It is my duty to become a Knight and I am currently on my quest to gain the favour of the Lady.
{=!}I have only just set out on my journey, I have much to learn.
{=!}I hope you will achieve what you set out to do.
{=!}You shouldn't have wandered so far from home.
{=!}I am a questing Knight, devoted in life to the Lady and Bretonnia.
{=!}Who I am is second to what I do, I tend to those in need.
{=!}It has always been my calling to help the sick and wounded, my parents died when I was young and I do not wish for others to experience such pain.
{=!}I dedicated my life to Shallya, in return I have been given a gift for healing others.
{=!}Since I have been travelling the Empire, looking to where my skills are needed most. Tending to peasant and soldier alike.
{=!}I see.
{=!}I understant.
{=!}I am a Priestess of the Goddess Shallya, dedicated to the arts of healing.
{=!}You don't need to know my story stranger, just my skills.
{=!}I'm a Court Huntsman, well. I was. Lets just say I missed my mark by the rump of a noble.
{=!}Now I track, hunt and do mercenary work for coin.
{=!}I have hunted all manner of beast and beastmen, even the occasional orc. My skills go to the highest bidder.
{=!}I am a Huntsman, many monsters have been slain by my hand in service of the Empire.
{=!}Hm, you wish to know of my life? It is a tale I can share.
{=!}I have always been surrounded by death, death is everything in Sylvania.
{=!}My fate was never to join the undead roaming the land, but to control them. To raise them and bend them to my will.
{=!}It has taken time but the dead do my bidding and my powers are ever growing.
{=!}I couldn't really care less about your wretched origin.
{=!}I am a master of death and undeath, many fear me. Do you?
{=!}I do not remember much of my past life, there is only the now and the thirst.
{=!}Being human feels like a dream, a dream I was happily liberated from.
{=!}I was taken from my village for the blood tax, but instead I became the desire of my vampire master. I was blessed with the gift of Nagash
{=!}My master however perished during the vampire wars, with no one else I have been left to wander the night since.
{=!}I couldn't really care less about your wretched origin.
{=!}I'm a fledgeling Vampire, powerful and undying.
{=!}Shattered memories, warrior, soldier? So long ago.
{=!}Much is lost, bloodshed, battle, death.
{=!}I serve, I fight, I destroy.
{=!}I see.
{=!}I am a Wight King, servant in death.

{=!}The Cult of Sigmar, also sometimes called the Church of Sigmar, the Holy Temple of Sigmar, the Clergy of Sigmar or simply the Sigmarite Cult, is the state church of the Empire that administrates the worship of that realm's patron god, Sigmar Heldenhammer. The Cult of Sigmar was founded by the wild-eyed friar Johann Helstrum in the year 73 IC, when he appeared before the masses to relate a vision that he experienced of Sigmar kneeling before Ulric, the god of war and winter, who placed the crown of godhood upon his brow as Sigmar took his place amongst the deities of the Old World Pantheon. As of today, the Cult of Sigmar has become an essential part of Imperial society. Nearly every city, town or village within the Empire has dedicated a portion of their wealth and land to the creation and maintenance of a Sigmarite temple, from which a priest of the Cult of Sigmar will attend to the spiritual well-being of its citizenry, whether it be through holy words of prayer or through heroic actions and trials by combat.

{=!}The Cult of Taal and Rhya is among the most ancient and pervasive in the Old World, tracing a direct line to the primal gods from the deepest of history. The cult grew organically, as early Humans tried to explain natural phenomenon, such as thunder, the turning of the seasons, and the rise and ebb of the seas. Over time, the Gods Taal and Rhya came into being, beginning as a single entity, known as Ishnernos. This split occurred many thousands of years ago, and the Cult of Ishnernos faded into distant memory. Taal rules nature and is considered King of the Gods. He claims the wild places as his domain and is primarily worshipped by hardy woodsmen, trackers, and rangers. Rhya's worshippers are found in the cultivated fields and orchards of the Empire, and are found among farmers, fishermen, and young lovers everywhere. The Cult of Taal and Rhya is the sanctioned cult of Talabecland, and is wildly popular in the eastern and northern parts of the Empire. Of the two, Taal receives most recognition, and Rhya's role is much diminished. The grand city of Talabheim is particularly fervent in its worship of both Taal and Rhya. However, in other cities, although Rhya's name is commonly known, he worship is rare, leading many urbanites to conclude that her cult is on the decline.
{=!}Cultist of Sigmar
{=!}Warrior Priest
{=!}Arch Lector

{=!}A Warrior Priest of Sigmar is a priest of the Cult of Sigmar who is a member of a warrior-sect whose duty is to both lead and inspire Imperial troops on the field of battle and also to minister to their spiritual needs when facing the Empire's foes.

{=!}The Warrior Priest is unleashing the wrath of Sigmar which will make his and surrounding allies melee attacks stronger (20%) for 8 seconds. 
 Troops with the effect can’t be staggered. 
 For every points in Faith, the melee effect becomes 0.05% stronger and 0.05 seconds longer. 
 Cooldown: take 50 points of damage.
